abstract.p: Sony Corp agrees to sell manufacturing operations in northern Japan and Taiwan to Solectron of Milpitas, Calif, leading maker of electronics for other companies; photos (S)

block.p: The world's top maker of consumer electronics, Sony, has agreed to sell manufacturing operations in northern Japan and Taiwan to Solectron of Milpitas, Calif., a leading maker of electronics for other companies. Terms were not disclosed. Sony will outsource manufacturing of consumer products like auto satellite navigation systems, car audio equipment and lithium-ion batteries to Solectron. Sony's president, Kunitake Ando, told a news conference that the deal represented the beginning of a new relationship between the companies, suggesting that further sales of some Sony operations to Solectron were possible.
